page.title: 02LAND USE AROUND OGBOURNE
page.content: Around Ogbourne St Andrew the land is used mainly for{arable farming.}The main crops grown are wheat barley and oats.A lot of land is used for grazing cattle, particularly around Southend, and the northern part of the area is primarily used for{intensively managed {grassland.}In the west of the area, around Rockley, there are{plantations {of trees,}mostly deciduous.Along the River Og there are some patches of water_meadowland. The farms are highly mechanised, using modern machinery such as combine harvesters, tractors, ploughs and seed_drills.The wheat and barley grown on the farms are high_yielding varieties, sprayed with pesticides, insecticides and fungicides, so producing better quality crops.
